name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Make Your Sunday Shine with New Connections!✨There’s something magical about slow Sunday mornings and even more so when shared with strangers who might just become new friends.This table is all about starting the day right: with good food, easy conversations, and the kind of calm energy that only a Sunday breakfast can bring. Think clinking cutlery, warm coffee, and unfiltered stories over eggs, toast, and laughter.Whether you're a morning person or just here to meet new people, come as you are! Let's share a table, swap stories, and ease into the day together.Because a slow morning with new faces might just be the best part of your week.

location.address: Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: HighTable is a unique social experience where you get to dine with 4-10 people and engage in meaningful conversations. Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru ft. Siva Prayojan
description: This evening is all about celebration and coming together as an inclusive community supporting a worldwide conscious movement where we will arrive at a safer space to let go, feel free, connect with our authentic selves and move to the organic beats of our body with, ECSTATIC DANCE BENGALURUDance for WellnessYour monthly doze of Dance Medicine. (Every last Sunday of the month) 📅 25th May 2025 | Sunday ⏳ 5pm - 7pm 📍Pebble - The Jungle Lounge ★ TIMELINE4.30pm: Doors open 4.45pm: Check in / warm up music 5.00pm: : Opening circle / intro 5.15pm: Ecstatic Dance set 6.45pm: Closing / sharing circle 7.00pm : Hugs & Hangout (Doors close at 5.15pm. Kindly arrive on time.) ★ ABOUT: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru is a regular conscious dance chapter with monthly free flow sessions, powered by Ecstatic World, pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020. From the makers of Odessa Amsterdam, the most popular conscious dance hub in Amsterdam, they create transformational experiences with Ecstatic Dance as dance for wellness for all. 👣 Dance for your well being 👣 Dance for your mental health👣 Dance as a self love ritual 👣 Dance for all 👣 Dance for freedom 👣 Dance for change 👣 Dance to life With Ecstatic Dance, we will connect with the self and others, enjoy moments of bliss and freedom, allowing the music to take us on a musical journey following a few basic guidelines. ★ ECSTATIC DANCE GUIDELINESIn ecstatic dance, We are without 🙅🏾👣 Footwear, to be grounded 🍺 Intoxicants, to be clear 🤐 Talking, to be embodied 📷 Mobile phones / camera, to be fully present Ft. ★ SIVA PRAYOJAN Siva Prayojan is celebrated as a multifaceted artist who seamlesslyblends a wide array of electronic music genres, including Techno, Melodic, Progressive, Drum and Bass, andTrance. His artistic journey, which commenced in 2021, is marked by a resolute departure from mainstream trends.Known for pushing boundaries, he continues to experiment with newsounds and redefining each performance for a deep dance journey.He expresses immense gratitude for the profound resonance his music finds in the hearts of those who immerse themselves in his sonic landscapes.We at Ecstatic World are elated to have him on board as our musical guide for the Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru chapter.     ★ ADDITIONAL INFO- We maintain our personal boundaries with the namaste sign. - Respect the space and one another.- Move however you wish. - If you are coming with a child, kindly tend to them wholeheartedly so as to maintain the quietness of the space during the opening and closing circle. - Dress comfortable. -Kindly take care of personal hygiene before joining the session. -Avoid wearing strong smelling perfumes / synthetic fragrances.-Maximum capacity 100 per session. - Please kindly note that upon purchasing a ticket, ED Bengaluru team and management are not liable for any injury that may incur at the session. That you agree to take full responsibility of yourself, your child’s safety and all of your belongings. ★ DRESS CODE   The fit you shine best in. ★ TICKET PRICE1500 INR (incl. taxes), via Urbanaut 2000 INR (incl.taxes), at the door Student ticket available at 50 % discount (at the door)  ▪Mandatory to produce a valid student ID card at check in.▪no cash, only gpay !★ CONNECTTag us on your IG stories and posts to let us know you are coming. Help us spread the awareness of this conscious dance practice in your own creative way and get a chance to win a free ticket for our upcoming sessions. IG : @ecstaticdancebengaluruFB : Ecstatic World  WhatsApp: ‪+91 93247 65794‬Email: ecstaticdanceworld@gmail.com ★ VENUE Pebble - The Jungle Lounge,Palace Grounds 3, Bellary Road,     Bengaluru-560080 ★ DESIGN  Elevantis Studio★ JOIN THE CONSCIOUS GLOBAL DANCE MOVEMENT HAPPENING IN ALL MAJOR CITIES/ COUNTRIES AROUND WORLD.....🌻 #befreebeyou 👣 #ecstaticdancebengaluru 🇮🇳 #ecstaticdanceindia ♥ #danceforwellness🏳‍🌈 #inclusivity🌏 #globalcommunity🙏🏾 #safespace

location.address: Gate number 9, Princess Academy, Palace Grounds 3 , Ramana Maharishi Road, Bellary Rd, Jayamahal, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560080, India

organizer.name: Ecstatic World
organizer.description: Pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020, ECSTATIC WORLD is a conscious events company creating transformational experiences. The logo of Ecstatic World is an Egyptian sign symbolizing, 'Transformation of the self'.

name: The Love Lab
description: A date that’s fun, fresh, and a little bit genius.Think you know each other? Time to test the theory.The Love Lab is a playful, pop-up experience for couples who want to connect, laugh, and learn something new (without the pressure).Not therapy. Not a boring workshop. Just a super fun way to upgrade your relationship — with mini challenges, games, and tools you’ll actually use.Try out relationship “experiments” backed by real scienceExplore quirky communication boothsTeam up for couple games & connection promptsNo lectures. No pressure. No “fixing” required.Just two people, some cool tools, and a little relationship magic.Whether you’re a few dates in or years into forever—this is your excuse to ditch the usual and do something unforgettable. Together.📅 When:June 7th, 4 pm onwards (you can stay for as long as you like, we close at 8pm)📍Where:21/1, Church Rd, Kanakapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004📞 Contact: +91 63664 29922

name: Bohra Cuisine with Strangers
description: Make Your Sunday Shine with New Connections!✨The Shared Circle is not your average dining table—it’s a slice of Bohra tradition where strangers sit shoulder to shoulder, eat with their hands, and leave with full hearts. Set in a warm Bengaluru home, this 9-course Bohra meal is a soulful journey into a culinary heritage shaped by centuries, migration, and memory.From the richness of biryani to the comfort of smoked dal samosas, each dish is steeped in legacy and slow-cooked with love. But the real magic? It’s in the conversations, the laughter, the feeling that somehow, in this moment, you belong.This isn’t just food—it’s communion. If you've never dined Bohra-style, this is your invitation to slow down, open up, and savour a meal the way it was always meant to be: together.🥂

name: Sound Healing + Breathwork at Nidhaana
description: Sundown Sound Healing    Unwind. Release. Restore.Ease into the week ahead with a calming journey through breath and sound.                                                                             We begin with gentle breathwork to center the mind and connect with the body—preparing you to receive the healing vibrations that follow.                                                                                                                                                                                  Tibetan bowls ground your energy                                                                                                                                    Chimes clear mental clutter                                                                                                                                                      The space drum invites movement and flow                                                                                                                                 The rainmaker soothes like soft rain                                                                                                                                            Together, breath and sound create a quiet space to unwind, restore, and settle into stillness.

location.address: Shop No 5, Jinvara, Hobli, Yelahanka, Avalahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064, India

organizer.description: Nidhaana is a yoga and wellness studio with a cozy café, built around the idea of slowing down. We offer group yoga, yoga brunches, and wellness workshops for all ages. More than a space, Nidhaana is a community to nourish your body, mind, and soul—one mindful moment at a time.

name: Terrarium-Making workshop & Playtime at Klayzo
description: Create miniature ecosystem & engage with soil and natural elements, releasing happy hormones. Foster creativity and mindfulness through hands-on activities. Share the joy of nurturing live plants with fellow participants & carry your creation home. About the Founder – Saloni Kumar﻿Saloni Kumar, founder of Healing Garden, A certified nature therapy practitioner, she supports stress and trauma recovery through nature-based practices. She is currently advancing her meditation training and has volunteered with children with special needs.About KlayZoKlayzo, by the House of KLAY, is a thoughtfully designed indoor play zone that supports modern parenting needs. It offers a safe, flexible space for children to explore, create, and learn through open-ended, holistic play. With a mission to empower both kids and parents, Klayzo focuses on joyful experiences and emotional well-being. Its core values include being playful, warm, imaginative, and empowering. The space encourages curiosity, movement, and hands-on fun, helping children thrive in a nurturing environment.

location.address: Lower Level, Plot 18B, off ITPL Main Road, next to Shell Petrol Pump, Ashraya Layout, Garudachar Palya, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560048, India

organizer.name: Klayzo
organizer.description: Klayzo is Bangalore’s first on-demand indoor playzone—independent play, trusted care, no parents needed! With live CCTV access and 360° fun—ball pit, climbing wall, rope tunnel, Lego city, magnetic play, doodle wall, puzzles, and more—your child is in for a creative adventure!

name: Blueprint of Burden: Screening An Engineered Dream
description: A screening of "An Engineered Dream"Followed by a Q&A with director Hemant GabaStep into the high-pressure world of Kota, where over a hundred thousand students arrive each year chasing dreams not always their own. An Engineered Dream is a powerful documentary exploring how societal and parental expectations shape — and sometimes shatter — the futures of India's youth.This eye-opening film examines the intense culture of coaching institutes and the emotional toll it takes, set against the backdrop of their lives and dreams.🗣️ Stay after the screening for a live conversation with director Hemant Gaba, followed by an audience Q&A.

location.address: 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai, #24 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Boo!Ya Watchin?
organizer.description: Boo! ya watchin? is a screening collective curating cult, camp, and essential cinema—with context. From scream queens to the world's authentic cinema gems, we screen stories that speak to community, memory, and madness.

name: Didgeridoo Sound Healing + Breathwork
description: Sound Bath with Brandon Colaco : A Didgeridoo Healing ExperienceDrift into a deep, immersive soundscape where breath becomes rhythm and ancient frequencies awaken the body and mind.Join us for a powerful sound bath led by Brandon Colaco, one of India’s leading didgeridoo artists. This experience begins with gentle stretching and breathwork, grounding the body and preparing you to fully receive the healing vibrations of the didgeridoo. You’ll then rest in Shavasana for an extended sound journey , followed by a guided integration circle to close.What to Expect:	•	A 20-minute movement + breathwork session to release tension and prepare for the healing sound bath - led by Vivek	•	A 50-minute didgeridoo sound immersion led by Brandon Colaco	•	Integration and sharing circle to complete the session with grounding and reflectionBenefits:The didgeridoo is one of the world’s oldest instruments, traditionally used by the Aboriginal people of Australia. Its infrasonic frequencies (below the range of human hearing) create deep, cellular-level vibrations that promote:	•	Physical healing: reduce inflammation, relieve pain, and support tissue repair	•	Mental clarity: enhance focus, creativity, and emotional balance	•	Spiritual insight: support lucid dreaming, deep rest, and inner stillness	•	Sleep regulation and nervous system resetBrandon’s fusion of traditional didgeridoo with Konnakol rhythms from South India creates a unique, deeply resonant sound experience unlike any other. With over 15 years of experience and a presence on global stages from Europe and being features in Rolling Stone India/Australia, his sound immersions are known to be transformative.This is more than a sound bath—it’s a healing experience for body, mind, and spirit.

name: Align & Design-Tarot-Guided Vision Board Session
description: This is not your average vision board session.Align & Design is a 90-minute guided experience that helps you create from a place of stillness, intention, and intuition. You’ll start with a short meditation to ground your energy, then pull a tarot card to uncover your focus for the session. From there, you’ll build a vision board that reflects what truly matters to you — not just what looks good on paper.No tarot or creative experience required. This is a calm, supportive space for reflection, clarity, and creative direction.✨ What’s Included:·       10-min grounding meditation·       Tarot card pull with prompts·       Intention setting·       Vision board creation materials ·

name: 💌 Letters to Strangers
description: ​In a world of quick replies and seen ticks, this is a return to something slower, simpler, and more human.​Join us for a casual coffee meetup where we’ll write handwritten letters—not to friends you already know, but to strangers across the table. Through gentle prompts, you’ll write from the heart: reflections, questions, memories, or a moment captured in ink.✨ What to Expect:​📝 Prompts, not pressure. You’ll be gently guided to write.📓 Paper, Pen & Presence. We’re keeping it analogue—no digital devices.☕ Coffee & quiet company. A warm cup to keep you grounded as you write.

name: Behindert (1974) with The Parallel Cinema Club
description: Our weekly meetings feature a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. Led by one of our members or occasionally a guest speaker, the discussion encourages participants to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.Behindert (1974)Described by Stephen Dwoskin as “a documentary without being one,” the basis of BEHINDERT is autobiographical: the story of a physically disabled man and a physically normal woman- played by Dwoskin (who has a post-polio disability) and Carola Regnier- who confront the difficulties of a relationship. The two were no longer a couple at the time Dwoskin made the film, yet it burns with the passion and intensity of true love.About The Parallel Cinema ClubA community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

location.address: 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai, #24 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Rafoo:Bengaluru Mending Beyond Fabric Workshop
description: In this reflective hands-on workshop, we’ll engage with fabric as a way to explore ideas of rupture, repair, and resilience. Through processes like cutting, stitching, and layering, participants will be invited to work with cloth as a surface for personal expression and quiet transformation Rather than aiming for perfection, we’ll embrace irregular threads, raw edges, and visible mends as part of the story. Together, we’ll explore what it means to tend to what feels broken, in fabric, and perhaps within or around us.All materials will be provided. However if you have a piece of clothing or fabric you’d like to mend or embellish, feel free to bring it along. No prior stitching experience needed

name: Hot Conversations over Hot Sauce
description: Hot Conversations over Hot Sauce 🌶️Spice up your conversations — literally!Pull up a chair, and get ready for an evening where the hot sauce bites back and the questions go deep. At this table, every chit you pull serves you two things: a spicy question and an even bolder conversation.Think of it as truth-or-dare with a dash of habanero. From mild musings to sweat-inducing truth bombs, you'll be laughing, sniffling, and oversharing in the best way possible.So whether you're a chilli champ or a sweet-heat kinda soul, come as you are — and leave with a few new friends and some wild storiesBecause real connections start when the spice kicks in!🔥

name: Wine Tasting: A Night in Red with Penfolds
description: Bangalore wine lovers — ready for a legendary Friday night?Join us for A Night in Red with Penfolds: an epic wine tasting evening that brings together five premium wines, bold flavours, and unbeatable vibes at the stunning Muro, Bangalore. Hosted by two fun wine geeks, Sommelier Devati Mallick (Founder, Drink With D Wine Experiences) and Penfolds Brand Ambassador Joshua Lim, expect an exciting deep dive into the world of Penfolds, Australia’s most legendary winery!We’re tasting 5 iconic wines from the Penfolds portfolio, including a tasting of the famed Bin Series:– Koonunga Hill Chardonnay– Koonunga Hill 76 Shiraz Cabernet– Bin 2 Shiraz Mataro– Bin 28 Shiraz– Bin 389 Cabernet Shiraz (The famous Baby Grange)This and 5 specially curated Muro small plates that are as bold and flavour-packed as the wines. Expect an evening of stories, sips, elevated pairings, and great conversations — all in an intimate, luxurious, and fun vibe with our cool wine community in the city!Dress code: Red, or any shade of red. Bring in the RED energy!If you’re a red wine lover, a Penfolds fan, or just here for an unforgettable wine experience, this one’s for you. Come, swirl, sip, and experience an EPIC Friday night with us.20 seats only!

name: SLOW BURN YOGA BRUNCH
description: Join us for Slow Burn—a strength-infused yoga flow designed to ignite your inner fire while honoring your natural rhythm. This 75-minute studio session blends slow, intentional movement with light weights to help you build strength, ground your energy, and reset from within—without the rush.After class, unwind on the patio with a nourishing brunch spread crafted to replenish and restore. Come move, breathe, and linger awhile.

name: Aprisio 'Back In Time Rock Experience'
description: Aprisio presents the 'Back In Time Rock Experience'.Relive the soundtrack of your youth. Step into a night that’s not just about music — it’s about memories, moods, and moments that defined who we were. Join us as we go 'Back In Time' with the greatest hits of the 70s, 80s, and mid 90s — a time when rock wasn’t just a genre, it was an identity. This isn’t just another rock gig. At Aprisio, every element is thoughtfully curated and designed for our 40+ community.This immersive evening is crafted for those who want to not just hear the music, but feel it — in their bones, their stories, their laughter, and their conversations.What’s In Store:Live Band PerformanceA high energy rock band - Soul Smoke - playing classics from Dire Straits, Bon Jovi, Fleetwood Mac, Pink Floyd, Queen, Eagles, and more.The Story Behind the Songs​Between sets, enjoy short interludes where a MC unravels the stories, cultural impact, and memories behind some of your favourite tracks.Vinyl Memory Lounge​Explore a pop-up installation of iconic vinyl covers and song trivia. Share your own memories on our retro message wall.Make Your Own Mixtape​Curate a personal playlist from a printed catalog of songs — swap stories with fellow guests about your teenage rock anthems.Band Tees​Come dressed in your favourite band T-shirt. We are giving prizes for the best vintage look!Event Details🗓️ Date: Sunday, 1st June​📍 Venue: Downtown Pub (Basement), Residency Road​🕖 Time: 7 pm onwards​🎟️ Tickets: Rs. 2,500 per person plus 18% GST. The ticket includes coupons worth Rs. 1,000 redeemable against food & beverages at the venue.Tickets are required for all guests over the age of 8.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21 as per the Karnataka Excise rules.

location.address: 41 42, Residency Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

organizer.name: Aprisio
organizer.description: Aprisio is a space for people in their 40s and beyond to find community through shared moments.​ From masterclasses to immersive experiences, we create ways to connect that feel natural, meaningful, and real.​

name: Haal Khayal: What's the language of our souls?
description: Haal Khayal: What's the language of our souls?A workshop to honor our feelings, thoughts and emotions and find a non-verbal language to express them through the mediums of threads and textiles.In this workshop, we will focus on our moods and feelings, using stitching- a rhythmic and meditative tool to process, reflect, and express our emotional landscapes. Through the act of making marks on fabric, participants will explore how simple, repetitive stitches can convey complex emotions, transforming inner feelings into tangible, creative expressions.This is a shorter, more affordable version of our full-length workshops, designed to be accessible to a wider audience. Basic materials will be provided. If you’d like to bring your own fabric or threads to make the experience more personal, you’re welcome to do so. No prior stitching experience needed.Please Note: All proceeds from this workshop go toward supporting and sustaining Rafooghar's community space in New Delhi where women who live on the margins gather every Sunday for rest, leisure, and emotional repairDesigned and facilitated by Rafooghar-the house that mendsOrganized by The Drawing Room ClubSpace courtesy: Cafe ZubaanJoin The Drawing Room Club here:https://chat.whatsapp.com/Jl5TUSVgxBU9ZOI1oMMYO4
